DOC.brief_summary: Placement of a vaginal pessary reduces significantly the rate of spontaneous preterm birth in pregnant women with short cervical length at 18-22 weeks scan.
DOC.brief_title: Prevention of Preterm Birth Using Cervical Pessary in Pregnant Women With Short Cervix
DOC.detailed_description: This trial includes pregnant women undergoing routine ultrasound examination at 18.0 to 22.6 weeks of gestation.
DOC.criteria: Singleton pregnancy Minimal age of 18 years Major fetal abnormalities (requiring surgery or leading to infant death or severe handicap) SROM at the time of randomization Cervical cerclage in situ Active vaginal bleeding Previous cone biopsy or cerclage Major uterine structural anomalies Placenta previa
